It won’t be long yeah, till I belong to you

Note the pun on “be long/belong”—according to MacDonald, this was a particular favourite of Lennon’s.

In ‘It won’t be long till I belong to you’ it was that same trip. We both liked to try and get a bit of double meaning in, so that was the high spot of writing that particular song. John mainly sang it so I expect that it was his original idea but we both sat down and wrote it together.
–Paul McCartney

Every night when everybody has fun
 Here am I sitting all on my own

Based on three chords, ‘It Won’t Be Long’ says ‘Lennon’ in every bar (especially the one grotesquely dropped from the verse to make it go faster).
- Ian MacDonald, Revolution In The Head

The verse, about the misery of loneliness following a break up, is kept short in order to get back to the “yeah, yeah, yeah” chorus quickly.

It won’t be long yeah, yeah, yeah
 It won’t be long yeah, yeah, yeah

The ‘yeah, yeah, yeah’s were seen as a highlight of “She Loves You.” Why use such a great trick just once?

They would later use it again in “Mother Nature’s Son” and “Polythene Pam.”
